content.description: Start seated from the undercling and make a couple of burly moves to climb into Fern Crack (v3).
content.location: In the alcove on the right side of the Doja boulder

content.description: Start on the initial feet of Fern Crack and make an unfathomable move up to the start holds of Fern Traverse. Top out right.
content.location: In the alcove on the right side of the Doja boulder.

content.description: Left hand down on undercling and right hand on sloperto the right.  Get feet on and slap your way up the pyramid.  Nice Route
content.location:
In the east forest just up and to the east from last clearcut boulders.  The problem is on the Hondo boulders, and is on a smaller boulder 20 meters to the east of

Dojo

.

content.description: SDS on lowest crimpers. Go up with your left another set of crimpers and then go out to the lip with your right hand.  Traverse to the right on the lip and Topout by the tree.
content.location:
Middle Forest.  Right in front of

Pyramid Ale

and

Dojo

is right behind this problem.  There are a ton of great problems on these boulders, which are called the Hondo Boulders.

content.description: Start matched on the far right sloper. Make a campus move out left before finding some feet and traversing into the good holds of Fern Crack. The book calls this a V6, but it's definitely easier than Fern Crack.
content.location: In the alcove on the right side of the Doja boulder.

content.description: Start on two head height slopey crimps, a far right foot, and move to a gaston/tensiony move.
content.protection: Landing is a little rocky, recommend 2 pads, and probably an active spot
content.location: On the right side of the Doja boulder. In the same area as Frequent Flyer

content.description: Slight variation on Doja adding a lower start.  Match hands on gaston/pinch to the right of starting crimp for Doja.  A far right toe hook may be helpful.  Make two fairly strenuous moves to match the original start and finish as for Doja.

In the East forest slightly up and right from the easternmost clearcut boulders.  Obvious line of crimps traversing an overhang.  Heel hooking bumpfest with a huge jug to top out on.  Nice intro to the grade.
content.protection: Awkward landing - nice to have two spotters and several pads.

content.description: SDS on jug and lunge for the lip.  Mantle up to the right.
content.location:
Hondo Boulders.  On the boulder just to the south of

Dojo

.

content.description: SDS as low as you can in the cave.  Climb flake/crack out of the cave and straight up face.  Great topout and classic problem.
content.location:
On same boulder as

Dojo

To the left of

Dojo

.  Straight up and a little to the east of eastern most clearcut boulders.
